title: The footpath and highway:
author: Moran, Benjamin
snippet: The view from this elevated point takes in the whole of the city, with the towering cliff of Arthur's Seat at one end, and the old castle of the Scottish  capital at the other ; while seaward appears the Frith of Forth and the German Ocean, and northward the Ochils, East Lomond, and distant Grampian hills.

title: Jane Seton: or, the Kings Advocate. A Scottish historical romance
author: Grant, James
snippet: Meanwhile Leslie was galloping by the northern baseof the East Lomond.

title: Jane Seton: or, the Kings Advocate. A Scottish historical romance
author: Grant, James
snippet: The last rays of the sun had vanished from thefurzy sides and green summit of the East Lomondonce caUed the Hdl of the Goats, in the language ofthe Celtic Scots, when he quitted the park of Falkland,and struck hito an ancient horseway, which, under theshadow of many a venerable oak tree, led him towardsKirkforthar; and soon the hid of Clatto became visibleas it rose about five mdes distant on his left.

title: Jane Seton: or, the Kings Advocate. A Scottish historical romance
author: Grant, James
snippet: A few hours after this, when the sun was setting onthe East Lomond, Lewis Leslie of Balquhan, mountedon a fleet horse, with the pardon, signed, sealed, andsecured in a pouch that hung at his waist-belt, wasgalloping through the parks of Falkland, on his way tothe capital.
